etymology.description: Depicts a foot 止 with a leg/thigh on top; similar to 足 while unrelated to the bottom part of 是
etymology.interpretation: The character 疋(pǐ) visually represents a foot with an attached leg or thigh, illustrating its primary meaning. It is visually similar to 足(zú, 'foot') but distinct from 是(shì, 'is'), reinforcing its focus on the anatomical structure.

examples.chinese: 他买了一疋绫(他買了一疋綾)。
examples.pinyin: Tā mǎi le yī pǐ líng.
examples.english: He bought a bolt of satin.

examples.chinese: 这件绸缎足有五疋长(這件綢緞足有五疋長)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn chóuduàn zú yǒu wǔ pǐ zhǎng.
examples.english: This piece of satin is five feet long.
